rationale: Replace the cross-sectional operator on the leverage signal from rank to zscore to standardize leverage across the universe rather than ranking, which may emphasize extreme values differently.
expression: liability_signal = zscore(normalize(liabilities/assets)); volatility = ts_std_dev(close, 20); reversal_signal = rank(-ts_delta(close, 3) / volatility); alpha = liability_signal * 0.8 + reversal_signal * 0.2;

rationale: Apply winsorization to cap extreme liabilities/assets before ranking, reducing sensitivity to outliers while preserving cross-sectional comparison.
expression: liability_signal = rank(winsorize(liabilities/assets, std=4)); volatility = ts_std_dev(close, 20); reversal_signal = rank(-ts_delta(close, 3) / volatility); alpha = liability_signal * 0.8 + reversal_signal * 0.2;

liability_signal = rank(normalize(liabilities/assets)); volatility = ts_std_dev(close, 30); reversal_signal = rank(-ts_delta(close, 5) / volatility); alpha = liability_signal * 0.8 + reversal_signal * 0.2;

liability_signal = rank(normalize(liabilities/assets)); volatility = ts_std_dev(close, 20); delta = ts_delta(close, 3); delta_smooth = ts_mean(delta, 5); reversal_signal = rank(-delta_smooth / volatility); alpha = liability_signal * 0.8 + reversal_signal * 0.2;

liability_signal = rank(normalize(liabilities/assets)); volatility = ts_zscore(close, 20); reversal_signal = rank(-ts_delta(close, 3) / volatility); alpha = liability_signal * 0.8 + reversal_signal * 0.2;
